categories.summary:
# Analysis of "discussion" Discord Channel

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily revolves around "Clank Tank," a new AI-powered governance system that simulates proposal evaluations in an entertainment format inspired by Shark Tank. Jin shared that Clank Tank aims to transform traditional DAO governance (described as "walls of text simulator") into engaging video content. The system includes token-based voting where users can send tokens to influence AI judges' decisions, with those tokens being burned. Future plans include a "superchat" feature allowing token holders to have comments read during deliberations, real-time pitching to AI judges, and integration of prediction markets. The community discussed potential applications including project incubation, accelerator programs, and integration with auto.fun. There were also brief discussions about CollabLand issues and potential migration to Vulcan, as well as questions about the project's Twitter account status and possible rebranding from AI16Z to ElizaOS.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How does the voting approach in Clank Tank work? (asked by Skinny) A: Users send tokens to cast votes, which get burned. Jin plans to implement a threshold system where comments can be read aloud during deliberation to influence the AI (answered by jin)
Q: How will Clank Tank handle the "stories segment" like in Shark Tank? (asked by 3on_.) A: They'll build an "AI powered CMS" with agentic data/research pipelines to track portfolio health and convert it into bite-size stories (answered by jin)
Q: Is CollabLand broken? (asked by Krippãƒˆãƒ¡ã‚¢) A: Yes, despite being on the premium plan, it's having issues (answered by jin and Odilitime)
Q: What about the tokenomics to drive value to $AI16Z token? (asked by Spyhard) A: Jin mentioned working on a draft about Clank Tank tokenomics to share after feedback (answered by jin)
Q: Is there a GitHub for the DAO website? (asked by MonteCrypto) A: Jin mentioned clanktank.tv with a no sign-in flow for memos and Discord for auth (answered by jin)
Q: Is the rebranding from AI16Z to ElizaOS happening? (asked by phetrusarthurâœˆ) A: Unanswered directly, though Spyhard suggested a 1:1 token swap might occur

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: jin | Helpee: Krippãƒˆãƒ¡ã‚¢ | Context: CollabLand issues causing loss of partner/channels | Resolution: Jin shared a link to Vulcan as an alternative and tagged others for opinions
Helper: jin | Helpee: Spyhard | Context: Questions about token utility and tokenomics | Resolution: Jin offered to draft an explanation of Clank Tank tokenomics
Helper: Kenk | Helpee: Nevs | Context: User unable to see most conversations/updates | Resolution: Directed user to a specific channel (likely roles or verification)

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Implement superchat system for sending AI16Z tokens to get messages read during Clank Tank deliberations | Description: Allow token holders to influence AI judges | Mentioned By: jin
Technical: Develop real-time pitching feature for Clank Tank | Description: Enable live pitching to AI judges with countdown timer | Mentioned By: jin
Technical: Create system to track historical market performance of projects | Description: Factor voting track record into decision making process | Mentioned By: jin
Technical: Help with web3.js flow and memo generation for DAO website | Description: Offered assistance with development | Mentioned By: MonteCrypto
Feature: Integrate Clank Tank with auto.fun | Description: Use Clank Tank as selection mechanism for projects to be listed on auto.fun | Mentioned By: phetrusarthurâœˆ
Feature: Create Twitter community for ElizaOS | Description: Build community on Twitter to improve information sharing during account suspension | Mentioned By: satsbased
Documentation: Publish detailed tokenomics explanation for Clank Tank | Description: Share draft after feedback from trusted community members | Mentioned By: jin
Feature: Implement prediction market integration with Clank Tank | Description: Create show where characters discuss prediction markets with secondary betting | Mentioned By: 3on_.

# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ’»-coders

## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily revolves around issues with the Twitter plugin experiencing rate limiting and account restrictions. Users discuss receiving 429 errors despite having paid subscriptions, with one user ultimately discovering their Twitter app was banned for policy violations. There's also discussion about plugin development, specifically regarding the location of the current plugin-bootstrap repository, which has moved to the monorepo structure. A user inquires about where to place custom plugin files in a project created with the quick-start method, with guidance provided on linking standalone plugins. Additionally, there are brief mentions of creating agents that analyze Discord activity and convert it to attributes, with a reference to Neo4j as a knowledge graph solution.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Is the twitter plugin still broken? All I get is `Request failed with code 429` (asked by zqh) A: 429 indicates rate limiting; you may need to purchase a plan to avoid this issue (answered by 0xbbjoker and Rabbidfly)
Q: Is this version of plugin-bootstrap still being used in elizaos v1.4.2? (asked by Benquik) A: No, the new version is in the monorepo: https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/tree/develop/packages/plugin-bootstrap (answered by 0xbbjoker)
Q: Where do I put my custom plugin files in a project created with the quick-start method? (asked by Benquik) A: Can be outside of project as standalone; build plugin, then use "bun link" in plugin root and "bun link plugin-name" in project (answered by 0xbbjoker)
Q: Has anybody ever built an agent that takes discord or other social activity, and turns it into a set of attributes? (asked by Kenk) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: 0xbbjoker | Helpee: Benquik | Context: Needed to know current location of plugin-bootstrap repository | Resolution: Provided link to current version in monorepo
Helper: 0xbbjoker | Helpee: Benquik | Context: Needed to know where to place custom plugin files in quick-start project | Resolution: Explained how to use standalone plugins with bun link
Helper: Rabbidfly | Helpee: zqh | Context: Twitter plugin returning 429 errors | Resolution: Explained rate limiting and suggested purchasing a plan, though ultimately user discovered their app was banned
Helper: 0xbbjoker | Helpee: zqh | Context: Banned Twitter app | Resolution: Suggested trying a new account with a new app

## 4. Action Items:
Technical: Investigate Twitter plugin issues with rate limiting and banned accounts | Mentioned By: zqh
Technical: Implement proper handling of Twitter API rate limits in plugin | Mentioned By: Rabbidfly
Technical: Create agent that converts Discord activity into attributes | Mentioned By: Kenk
Documentation: Update references to plugin-bootstrap location in documentation | Mentioned By: Benquik
Documentation: Create guide for adding custom plugins to quick-start projects | Mentioned By: Benquik
Feature: Fix Twitter plugin to properly send tweet replies | Mentioned By: Rabbidfly

# Analysis of ðŸ¥‡-partners Discord Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around Clank Tank, an AI-led VC game show concept. Jin announced a new governance tool for voting on submissions, with multiple voting methods: onchain text-to-vote using ai16z tokens, Discord reactions, and direct voting on clanktank.tv. The system follows a structured process: user submissions, auto-generated news show, community voting combined with AI research/scoring, and final results synthesis into a Clank Tank episode. Some users asked clarification questions about voting mechanics, specifically whether multiple votes are allowed and how they're counted. There was also brief discussion about token performance, with mixed opinions on its current value and trading patterns. A reference was made to "shaw" working on an "AWS Agent-as-a-service gateway" (AaaS), though details were minimal.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Can you vote more than once? Or does that cancel your previous vote? (asked by Odilitime) A: Once per submission (answered by jin)
Q: But if someone accidentally votes more than once then which vote is counted? (asked by DorianD) A: Unanswered
Q: When shaw will come back? Boring without him (asked by Burtiik) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: jin | Helpee: Channel members | Context: Explaining the new Clank Tank voting system | Resolution: Provided comprehensive instructions for three voting methods and the overall process
Helper: Rabbidfly | Helpee: Milo | Context: Discussion about token fundamentals | Resolution: Suggested focusing on team activities (jin/kenk/shaw) and mentioned shaw creating "AWS Agent-as-a-service gateway"

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Implement governance tools for voting on AI-led VC projects | Description: System for community voting on submissions with multiple methods | Mentioned By: jin
Feature: Real-time vote changing during livestream | Description: Allow viewers to change votes during a live broadcast of the show | Mentioned By: DorianD
Technical: Development of "AWS Agent-as-a-service gateway" (AaaS) | Description: Creating agent-as-a-service infrastructure | Mentioned By: Rabbidfly

Token burning mechanics and programmatic buybacks were discussed as a potential feature, with jin advocating for a simple, verifiable approach that could be visualized through blockchain data rather than building it directly into elizaOS.
